place.name: BOZEAT
place.gazetteerText: BOZEAT, a parish in Wellingborough district, Northampton; on the verge of the county, 4 miles SE by E of Castle-Ashby r. station, and 6½ S of Wellingborough. Post Town, Easton-Mandit, under Northampton. Acres, 2,400. Real property, £3,374. Pop., 955. Houses, 211. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage, united with the rectory of Strixton, in the diocese of Peterborough. Value, £275.* Patron, Earl Spencer. The church is good. Charities, £22. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
